Package gameGUI

Class GUI

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Window
java.awt.Frame
javax.swing.JFrame
gameGUI.GUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class GUI
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
This class represents the GUI (Graphical User Interface), from which a user can control and play the game.
See Also:
Serialized Form

    changer is the core method for developing and shipping the functionality of the game.

    Method for checking if a match has ended in a win or in a draw.
    void corruptedFileHandler​(CorruptedFileException e)
    Handles the situation in which a user selects a file that is corrupted (a file is said to be corrupted when the board is in an unsafe state.
    void createBoard()
    Creates the game board.
    void createColorChooserGrid()
    Creates the color chooser interface.

    For synchronous loading task.

    Handles the situation of a file not found.

    Handles the situation of a player clicking again and again at a button corresponding to a full column.

    Initialize match players.
    void loadGame()
    Method for loading a match stored in a .txt file.
    void paintBoardWithColors​(Board gameBoard)
    Paints the board with the correct color, basing on the state of the board.
    void registerEventListener​(LoadInterface load)
    Necessary in order to adhere to the Observer design pattern
    void reloadGame()
    Method for resetting the match that is being played.
    void repaintBoard()
    Method that creates the board view and paints every panel (where the token will be placed in) in a pink color.
    void saveGame()
    Method for saving the match that is being played.
    void savingFileErrorHandler​(SavingFileException e)
    Handles the situation of an error occurring when saving a file.
    int selectSavedFileInterface​(javax.swing.JFileChooser chooser)
    Displays the JFileChooser frame, reconfiguring it, customizing what user can do in this view When the user chooses a file, this file is stored in the variable loadingFile.
    void setColorCorrespondingToButton​(javax.swing.JButton colorButton, Player player)
    Sets player's token to the color of the chosen button In order to shorten the code, this method is also concerned with setting visibility of elements in the biggestFrame JFrame (biggestFrame is the main frame of the application).
    void showColorGrid​(Player p)
    Show the interface from which a player can choose a color for his token.

  • Constructor Details

      public GUI()
      Creates the GUI

  • Method Details

    • initializeComponents

      public void initializeComponents()
      Initialize the actors of the game.

    • displayStartGameFrame

      private void displayStartGameFrame()
      Display the start/load game frame.

    • initializeMatch

      private void initializeMatch()
      Initialize match players.

    • showColorGrid

      public void showColorGrid​(Player p)
      Show the interface from which a player can choose a color for his token. Note that, for accessing the color grid (that is properly a shared resource), an additional variable is used as a mutex, mutexPlayer.
      Parameters:
      p - is the player calling the interface.

    • setColorCorrespondingToButton

      public void setColorCorrespondingToButton​(javax.swing.JButton colorButton, Player player)
      Sets player's token to the color of the chosen button In order to shorten the code, this method is also concerned with setting visibility of elements in the biggestFrame JFrame (biggestFrame is the main frame of the application).
      Parameters:
      colorButton - is the button pressed by the user
      player - is the player who has pressed it

    • createColorChooserGrid

      public void createColorChooserGrid()
      Creates the color chooser interface. This view wants to be a reference to game interfaces when choosing a player. It is created a matrix of buttons, each one filled with a different color (taken from a pool of constants in the field section). Player clicking on a button selects it. Once selected, the player will have his token colored like the clicked button.

    • initializeBoardComponents

      public void initializeBoardComponents​(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
      Initialize the content of the game board.
      Parameters:
      frame - is the frame in which initialize the components

    • createBoard

      public void createBoard()
      Creates the game board.

    • repaintBoard

      public void repaintBoard()
      Method that creates the board view and paints every panel (where the token will be placed in) in a pink color.

    • displayEndGameFrame

      private void displayEndGameFrame​(java.lang.String winnerName)
      Initialize the end game mainPanel.
      Parameters:
      winnerName - is the name of the winner, if there was a winner at all. In case of draw, an empty string is passed.

    • addFont

      public void addFont()
      Adds the font used in the whole game. The font used is a custom font, downloaded here: https://www.dafont.com/retro-gaming.font#null Credits to its creator: Daymarius This method adds the font to the local GraphicsEnvironment. Note that adding this new font is completely system-independent, since the file Retro Gaming.tff is located in a res directory of this project and there is no dependence to a linux or windows or unix system: the file is located using the File.separator String, that implicitly uses the system file separator. Last but not least, the font is registered in the GraphicsEnvironment. The font can be used calling component.setFont(gamingFont);

    • changer

      public void changer​(int column)
      changer is the core method for developing and shipping the functionality of the game. It decides what color to place in what position depending on the player playing the turn, determines if there was a victory when inserting a token in a column and so on. Note that it does what it is supposed to do connecting itself strictly with the logic of the game, that is separated. It calls gameComponents package methods in order to insert a token in a column, to determine a win or a draw and to get players' names, just to make some examples.
      Parameters:
      column - is the column the changer has to change, or where the action has taken place in the UI.

    • checkResults

      public void checkResults​(java.lang.String winnerName)
      Method for checking if a match has ended in a win or in a draw.
      Parameters:
      winnerName - is the name of the winning player. If it is a draw, winnerName is an empty string

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed​(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      Performs actions based on clicked buttons.
      Specified by:
      actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
      Parameters:
      e - is the event triggered by clicking the button

    • getClickedButton

      public static int getClickedButton​(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      Gets the clicked button.
      Parameters:
      e - is the event
      Returns:
      an integer representing the clicked column

    • changeColorInBoard

      public void changeColorInBoard​(Token token, int row, int col)
      Changes the color of the board according to the color of the token passed as input. Position of the board is specified as row, column.
      Parameters:
      token - is the token with its color
      row - is the row of the board
      col - is the column of the board

    • paintBoardWithColors

      public void paintBoardWithColors​(Board gameBoard)
      Paints the board with the correct color, basing on the state of the board. This method is fundamentally the method used when loading a match, because board coloring is triggered by clicking the column buttons of the board, not reproducible when loading a file.
      Parameters:
      gameBoard - is the gameBoard of the match.

    • customizeFileChooser

      public static javax.swing.JFileChooser customizeFileChooser​(javax.swing.JFileChooser fileChooser)
      Customizing method for a JFileChooser object. This method deletes every extension but .txt, in order to let user choose only this type of file. It disables the multi-choice selection.
      Parameters:
      fileChooser - is the fileChooser to change the characteristics of
      Returns:
      fileChooser the JFileChooser instance

    • registerEventListener

      public void registerEventListener​(LoadInterface load)
      Necessary in order to adhere to the Observer design pattern
      Parameters:
      load - is the interface observing

    • doTask

      public void doTask() throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, CorruptedFileException
      For synchronous loading task. Part of the implementation of the Observer design pattern.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file is not found
      CorruptedFileException - if the file is corrupted

    • selectSavedFileInterface

      public int selectSavedFileInterface​(javax.swing.JFileChooser chooser)
      Displays the JFileChooser frame, reconfiguring it, customizing what user can do in this view When the user chooses a file, this file is stored in the variable loadingFile. Next, the Observer Pattern is applied: - it is called a new LoadMatch instance as an interface - the GUI registers itself to this instance - synchronous task of loading the selected file begins - WHEN it ends, the match is finally initialized to the correct match stored in the given file Now it is possible to play a stored match.
      Parameters:
      chooser - is the JFileChooser object
      Returns:
      the status of the showOpenDialog method. Status can be APPROVE_OPTION if user pressed the continue button or CANCEL_OPTION if pressed the cancel.

    • loadGame

      public void loadGame()
      Method for loading a match stored in a .txt file.

    • reloadGame

      public void reloadGame()
      Method for resetting the match that is being played.

    • saveGame

      public void saveGame()
      Method for saving the match that is being played. Simply calls the SaveMatch class to save the file and creates and displays UI.

    • fullColumnHandler

      public void fullColumnHandler​(FullColumnException e)
      Handles the situation of a player clicking again and again at a button corresponding to a full column. It is a modal view, because UI enters in a modal state in which he cannot do anything but pressing the button. In order to catch his attention, it has been chosen to display this modal view as a brand new JFrame. Over that, the button text has been set to a message displaying a summary of what the error says: this choice is in line with Human-Computer interaction dogmas, because user usually does not read what it is written in a pop-up, so his attention locus (that is set to the button in the moment he's clicking it) sees what the button label says. In order to focus his attention completely on the pop-up, clicking the main frame is disabled until he clicks the button in this view. This prevents from generating n new JFrame, where n is the number of clicks on the full column button.
      Parameters:
      e - is the exception FullColumnException

    • corruptedFileHandler

      public void corruptedFileHandler​(CorruptedFileException e)
      Handles the situation in which a user selects a file that is corrupted (a file is said to be corrupted when the board is in an unsafe state. View IntegrityMatrix documentation). In order to catch his attention, it has been chosen to display this modal view as a brand new JFrame. Over that, the button text has been set to a message displaying a summary of what the error says: this choice is in line with Human-Computer interaction dogmas, because user usually does not read what it is written in a pop-up, so his attention locus (that is set to the button in the moment he's clicking it) sees what the button label says. In order to focus his attention completely on the pop-up, clicking the main frame is disabled until he clicks the button in this view.
      Parameters:
      e - is the exception CorruptedFileException

    • savingFileErrorHandler

      public void savingFileErrorHandler​(SavingFileException e)
      Handles the situation of an error occurring when saving a file. In order to catch user's attention, it has been chosen to display this modal view as a brand new JFrame. Over that, the button text has been set to a message displaying a summary of what the error says: this choice is in line with Human-Computer interaction dogmas, because user usually does not read what it is written in a pop-up, so his attention locus (that is set to the button in the moment he's clicking it) sees what the button label says. In order to focus his attention completely on the pop-up, clicking the main frame is disabled until he clicks the button in this view.
      Parameters:
      e - is the exception SavingFileException

    • fileNotFoundHandler

      public void fileNotFoundHandler​(java.io.FileNotFoundException e)
      Handles the situation of a file not found. In order to catch user's attention, it has been chosen to display this modal view as a brand new JFrame. Over that, the button text has been set to a message displaying a summary of what the error says: this choice is in line with Human-Computer interaction dogmas, because user usually does not read what it is written in a pop-up, so his attention locus (that is set to the button in the moment he's clicking it) sees what the button label says. In order to focus his attention completely on the pop-up, clicking the main frame is disabled until he clicks the button in this view.
